utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Expect the worst. These guys are beyond dangerous.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE ETHAN SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Is that all the guys you brought?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA ROGERS
utterance.content: How’re you holding up, kiddo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … this separation thing is getting really old.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I know. But Katherine is at a crossroads. The loss she suffered when she was young has just changed her in ways that she’s … just now beginning to realize. Can your mother give you a little unsolicited advice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Too bad. I need to work on my material.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your material?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Didn’t I tell you? I’m writing a book. Unsolicited Advice by Martha Rodgers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – – that’s actually a great idea.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I know! Isn’t it? Oh, and your agent loved it, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My agent?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Never you mind that. Just listen. Have faith. Things between you and Katherine have a tendency to just work themselves out. I think it’s probably good that she’s out of town for a couple of days because a little time apart is just what you need.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I need is a distraction.

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: The burglary, at what has been labeled as New York’s most secure building, is clearly a black eye for billionaire developer Ronald Booth, who’s keeping quiet about exactly what was stored but had this to say earlier...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. Welcome to Richard Castle Investigations.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Wow. You grew up nice.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry, do I know you?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Old friend of your dad’s. Ethan Slaughter.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Of – of course. Yeah. Let me just tell him you’re here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Def con 1 … Slaughter is here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here? Like right behind the door, here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does he want?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. He just said he was an old friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That can’t be good.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is that the old friend that almost got you killed a few years ago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, like six times. Okay, uh … I … uh … I can handle this. I’ll just, uh … I’ll just tell him … I’ll just tell him I’m not interested in, uh … in whatever it is.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey, Sherlock! Long time no see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Slaughter. Buddy. How’ve you been?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Not enough shootouts, but otherwise stellar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re not going to find many shootouts around here.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So good seeing you. You should come back again sometime.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Not so fast. We’ve got some business to discuss.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What kind of business?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ma’am, I don’t believe we’ve had the pleasure.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t ma’am me, darling. I’m Martha Rodgers, Richard Castle is my son, and the last time you did business together he was on anti-anxiety medication for a month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s kidding. Kidder. It was just – just a few weeks.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Well, you got a real mama lion here, Sherlock. But no reason to worry. What I’m here about won’t put you in a lick of danger, I promise.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm. And what’s that?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: A case I’m working on, I need help with. High end burglary in this big shiny building in Midtown.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The most secure building in New York? I just watched a news report about it.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. Seems somebody was able to bypass the alarm system and steal themselves a top secret microchip. The whole thing’s above my intellectual pay grade, so I thought Sherlock here could help me out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I thought you were gang taskforce?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Oh yeah. I got tired of that. I moved on to a whole new class of dirtbags.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m flattered you thought of me, that’s – my – my schedule is so full.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re swamped.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Completely swamped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Completely.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Okay. You don’t have to tell me twice. I got it. Great to see you again, Sherlock. I got some stories I was going to tell you to help you with your next book. Like this time I was chasing this cartel hit team through the sewers for three days, but that’s just going to have to be for another time. Ciao!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cartel hit team.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Be strong, Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the sewers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Slaughter! Wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m in.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Outstanding!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s our first move?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Lower East Side. A guy I know named Victor Lee.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Victim’s name is Victor Lee. 30 year old male. Died of exsanguination from that giant knife in his neck. Killed between 10 and 2 last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, let’s find out who the victim was talking to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about that bruising on his face?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s older. Looks like someone worked Mr. Lee over within the last twenty-four hours.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any hope of getting a print off that murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Doubtful. Looks like it’s been wiped clean.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Espo. Guess who the last person our victim called was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know how hard it is for me to not say ‘your mama’ right now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Slaughter?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey. What the hell happened to my guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle? Slaughter? This is not a pairing that I would have expected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, together again. Yay!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You got any leads?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We got our victim calling you last night. Care to share what you talked about?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Victor was my CI. Best damn snitch I ever had, ‘cause he wasn’t a criminal. He managed some burger joint. But he grew up with the rogues, a gallery of low-lifes, just too stupid not to keep bragging to him about the crimes they were committing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what was he calling you about?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Uh … he was doing some digging on this burglary I’m investigating.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, looks like that digging might have gotten him killed.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Are you saying this was my fault?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No – well, uh, was Victor talking to anyone else besides you?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: No, he said he was going to go meet someone. He didn’t give me the name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then our first step is to identify that guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, that’s our job. This is a homicide investigation.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Tough. It was my case first. Victor was my guy, so we’re going to find the rodent that killed him together. Come on, Sherlock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. But Slaughter? You’re going to keep us in the loop on every move you make.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Of course. I’m a team player.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I totally lied to those guys. I already got a line on who Victor might have met with last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you think that’s information we should share with Ryan and Esposito?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Nah. Isn’t this fun? You and me, together again. Like Butch and Sundance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know they die at the end of the movie, right?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: What a way to go.

utterance.speaker: DAWN
utterance.content: I can’t believe it. I just talked to him yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you talk to him about?

utterance.speaker: DAWN
utterance.content: Getting back together. We broke up a few months ago. I got sick of him not keeping his word. But he said it was going to be different this time. Told me he was about to come into some big money. We were talking about taking off together. California. I always wanted to live on the beach.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Did he say where this big money was coming from?

utterance.speaker: DAWN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you … excuse us a second?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think Victor might have been involved in stealing that microchip?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: No way. He was a straight arrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you liked the guy. But he was working a minimum wage job while all his criminal buddies were pulling in big cash. Is it so impossible to believe that he might have … given in to temptation?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s possible. I just hate the idea he was playing me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Victor say who he was meeting with last night?

utterance.speaker: DAWN
utterance.content: Some guy named Trucco.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I looked into Slaughter’s burglary case. The burglars made off with a microchip for a next-gen cell phone. Prototype is worth north of a million bucks on the black market. Vikram’s looking into databases of known fences to find out who deals in that kind of loot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, CSU managed to find a print on the murder weapon. It was hidden under the hilt of the knife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They get a match in the system?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re sending it now. Here it is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. Got it. Found Trucco. Turns out he’s a fence specializing in high-tech. What do you say we go shake his tree?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds good. Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At the office.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is Slaughter with you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, Castle. His prints were on the murder weapon. Slaughter killed Victor Lee.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Everything okay, Sherlock?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Who’re you talking to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s my mommy – mother. It’s my mother. I’m sorry, Mother, what were you uh, what were you saying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re headed to you right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you’re going to the club. How long until you get there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We are five minutes away.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So just play it cool.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, don’t let on that you’re talking to us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no problem.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: That ain’t your mom. It’s El-vez and Lucky Charms, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a slight problem –

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Give me that phone.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: What are you, Inspector Gadget? This is a gun, not a pen. You don’t keep it in your desk. You strap it to your side. Or in your case, keep it in your purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please don’t kill me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Not going to kill you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that what you told Victor before your buried a knife in his neck?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: That wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why were your fingerprints all over the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I gave Victor that knife as a thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A thank you gift? Flowers are a nice thank you gift. A giant Rambo knife, that’s psychotic.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, different strokes. But it’s the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just turn yourself into the boys. They’ll treat you fairly.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: It ain’t that simple. I may have hit Victor a few times yesterday morning when he wouldn’t look into that burglary for me, but I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Says the man holding a gun on me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Here. Take it. Take it. I didn’t tell you any of this before ‘cause I know how it looks. You didn’t doubt for a second that I killed Victor. Neither will anyone else. So the only way to clear my name is to find the real killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … why come to me?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: ‘Cause I got lots of enemies. What I don’t got is a friend. I need a friend, Sherlock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’s Slaughter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s gone. He left a few minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He insisted he was innocent. Said he gave that knife to Victor as a gift.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A gift? What’s wrong with a nice bottle of wine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know! But guys, I gotta tell you. He really seemed like he was telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Forget it. You can’t trust a word what that guy says. You of all people should know that, Castle!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was only a matter of time before he crossed the line and got caught.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re just lucky to be alive. Stay away from him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do not like lying to those guys, but you were right. They’re not going to give you the benefit of the doubt.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You’re a good man, Sherlock. Now we’re neck deep in this. Together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then we better get to work. Ryan and Esposito are good cops. They’re going to find you.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go hang Trucco out a window until he talks. Or we lose our grip. Vamonos muchacho!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where is this guy?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: My source says he’ll be here. Hey, any chance that smoking hot wife of yours is going to come hunting for me, too? Might be worth getting caught if she does the cuffing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … no. Beckett and I are sort of on a time out right now.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Oh. Sorry to hear that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: So, uh … what happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. She just said she needed time to figure things out.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Women.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: If you’re looking for a rebound, my cousin Shauna’s got a nympho roommate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … I’m good – I can – I’m good, thanks.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: All right, suit yourself. Nothing makes a woman want you more than moving on, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, conversation’s over. And – and – and another thing. This time, you need me. So we’re going to play it by my rules.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: And what rules are those?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not going to hurt anybody. You’re not going to intimidate anybody. You’re not even going to raise your voice. You do and I’m out.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You’re kidding, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Okay. Deal.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey, Trucco! Time to pay the piper, buddy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, hey, hey. What did I just say? Huh?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. My apologies, Mr. Trucco. My name is Detective Slaughter, this is Castle. We’d like to have a little chat with you about Victor Lee.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN TRUCCO
utterance.content: I’ve never heard of him.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Mr. Trucco, we both know that you fence high tech items for a living and that you had a deal with Mr. Lee to move a certain microchip that he stole. Now, unless you want us to go check out your place and see if we can find any stolen merchandise, I strongly recommend you tell us what we want to know.

utterance.speaker: TRUCCO
utterance.content: And what’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you buy a stolen microchip from Victor last night?

utterance.speaker: TRUCCO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: See, ass clown, I’ll tear your face off –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Please sir, tell us the truth.

utterance.speaker: TRUCCO
utterance.content: I am. Look, Victor and his partner were supposed to meet me last night but they never showed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s his partner?

utterance.speaker: TRUCCO
utterance.content: I don’t know. But from the way Victor talked about him it seems like they weren’t going to be partners for long.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thinking what I’m thinking?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Uh … probably not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That maybe Victor got greedy, tried to double cross his partner?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: And the partner might have killed him for it. Nice going, Sherlock. See, we make a perfect team. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: What was what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, check this out. Traffic cam caught Victor parked a block away from where the microchip was stolen. That is Victor right before the burglary - and there’s someone with him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Must be a partner. Is there a better look?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What if that’s Slaughter? I spoke to his Captain. Slaughter was reassigned from gangs because a dealer accused him of pocketing $20k during a drug bust. Word is, Slaughter was about to be suspended. Quite possibly kicked off the job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means bye-bye pension.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The microchip burglary might have been Slaughter’s retirement plan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if Victor tried to double cross him –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Slaughter would have put him down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But why involve Castle in all of this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Victor hid the microchip before he died. Slaughter couldn’t find it and so he thought he could fool Castle into using his unique brain to help him find it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it’s a good thing Castle’s not dumb enough to fall for that.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: So where do you think the chip is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Victor’s partner didn’t sell it to Trucco then they probably still have it.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ah hah. Oh, hey, who’s the talent?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Slaughter, this is Hayley.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: No wonder you weren’t interested in that nympho roommate, huh?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, just … forget it. Hayley just started working with me as a consultant.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes, Rick has asked me to suss out the break-in at Booth Tower.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Oh, she speaks British. That’s hot.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wow. It’s always a pleasure meeting one of your friends, Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s really not – just – please ignore him. Did you find anything?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Of course I did. So the security system at Booth Tower is definitely cutting edge. It would have taken a genius level digital locksmith to get through the several layers of alarm system.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: A genius? That sure as hell ain’t Victor or anyone he hangs with.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You sure about that? Because I did some digging and it turns out that Victor volunteered as a mentor to an underprivileged 16 year old boy named Louis Prince. Now, I hacked Louis’s records and he has quite the history of violence. Turns out he’s been in and out of several juvenile detention facilities and he was kicked out of four high schools.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Doesn’t sound too smart to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that his IQ?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh yes. 190.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: It’s like a criminal Good Will Hunting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And looks like he’s graduated to murder.

utterance.speaker: MARK WEST
utterance.content: Louis has had a rough life. He was abandoned by his father when he was five and then he was raised by his mother who has to work two jobs to support him. The kid was on his own twenty hours a day.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Not all latchkey kids wind up killers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re not all Einstein level geniuses, either.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Louis was – honestly, he was just too smart. And he didn’t have anyone to help nurture his talents, so all he could do was lash out. That’s when I first met him. I knew right away he was the perfect candidate for Operation Mentor. What he needed more than anything was a strong male role model to look out for him.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: That was Victor.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Eventually, yes. But Louis went through five other mentors, first. I got a lot of pressure to kick him out of the program. Victor was my last shot, but they hit it off right away and Louis started getting better. You know, Detective, you should consider becoming a mentor.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m not role model material.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s really not.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: You never know. I wasn’t always a counselor. I used to chase money around Wall Street for fifteen hours a day. But this here? This is definitely more fulfilling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I imagine so. Now, if Victor were to use Louis’s genius to help commit a crime, that would be quite a betrayal of trust, wouldn’t it?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Enough to make him snap and kill his mentor?

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Well, Victor was the first person that Louis ever trusted, besides his mom, so finding out he’d been betrayed would be pretty devastating.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Any idea where Louis might be hiding?

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Ah, I don’t know. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, uh … thank you very much for your time, Mr. West. We – we gotta go. Now.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. West, I’m Detective Ryan, this is Detective Esposito. NYPD. We just have a few questions about a kid Victor Lee was mentoring named Louis Prince?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s possible he might have some information that can help us solve a crime.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: That’s funny. You guys just missed the two other cops that were here. They were asking about Louis, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, got it. Hayley managed to track Louis down using the IP address on his computer. I have an address. Thank you very much for doing this, Hayley. I have another call. Thanks. This is Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You lied to us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, when you put it that way –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, no. This is not funny. What are you doing running around with our murder suspect?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Slaughter didn’t kill anyone, all right? I promise you, he wants to find Victor’s killer just as much as we do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? Did he tell you why he’s not working gangs anymore?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, he said he got bored.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. He got demoted. He’s under investigation for robbing a drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You robbed a drug dealer?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Oh, hell no. That’s a BS charge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Slaughter’s about to lose his pension, Castle. We figure he teamed up with Victor to steal that chip and then he got greedy.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Give me that. Hey, Detective, get your head out of our butt. Yeah, sure, I might have tuned Victor up a little bit, but I didn’t kill him. You’re wasting your time chasing after me. You should be after the kid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know you can just take the SIM card out, right? I lose more phones in this line of work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I wanted to walk away, you’d let me, right?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Having second thoughts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think that’s reasonable, given your history.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You mean given our history.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Freeze!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Stay with the kid, Sherlock!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. Relax. We’re not here to hurt you.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Please, please. Stay away from me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Come here. You’re okay. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re just trying to figure out what happened to Victor.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him, I swear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, hey. No one’s saying you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Not your proudest moment, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think he did it.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Sure he did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t see his face. He was scared. And young. It’s not the face of a killer.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: We’re all killers, Castle. When push comes to shove. Come on.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Do I still have to play nice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Good. Now, you’re going to tell me what you’re doing here or I’m going to pull your dipstick up to your chin like a zipper.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Okay. I came for the kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Because he’s the key.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I’m going to start zipping.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No, wait! I work for a crew that specializes in high end B and Es. Run by a guy named David Lacey.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ugh. I know Lacey. Gives sociopaths a bad name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you guys helped Victor steal the microchip?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: See, now he’s insulting our intelligence. Go get the shower curtain. It’s going to get a little messy.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: It’s true! Victor and the kid pulled off the microchip job alone. To send a message.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of message?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Victor was going around town boasting that he had the key to any lock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning Louis.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: The kid invented a device that could disarm any alarm system no matter how complex. So breaking into the Booth tower put the town on notice that Victor’s services were available to the highest bidder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Victor was using Louis. And your boss Lacey wasn’t interested in paying Victor’s price. So Victor ends up dead, you come here, pick up the kid free of charge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Slaughter! Put your hands up right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do it. Now!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Easy with that. That’s a little more weapon than you’re used to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You have the right to remain silent.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Heard it all before.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re going to need another unit to transport a second suspect. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Espo. Espo! He didn’t kill Victor. And if my instincts are right, neither did Louis. Which means there is a sixteen year old kid out there alone with a very dangerous crew after him. We’re going to need all hands on deck to find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not going to happen, Castle. Slaughter’s going in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you’re lucky I don’t arrest you, too, for aiding and abetting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Espo, please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, Castle. I won’t change my mind on this. Ryan. Ryan, where are we with that other unit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry – I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have done that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle just stole our murder suspect. And our car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you laughing at?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you laughing at?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, I think they know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They don’t know. No, that patrol unit totally bought our story about our car breaking down. Yo. Take him to holding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Come here. What happens when we don’t get the car back to the motor pool at the end of our shift? I think we should call Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And tell her what? That her husband staged a jailbreak right under our noses?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, technically your nose – – but that’s not the point. We just need to find Castle and Slaughter.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: We’ll be safe here until we figure out our next move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This can’t be your place.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two reasons: one, we’re both fugitives. Hiding at either of our apartments would be a terrible idea. Two, I picture your décor less Architectural Digest, more Guns and Ammo.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: It’s my ex-wife’s. She’s uh … out of town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. I had no idea you were married. What’s her name?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Maddie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I take it Maddie’s a fan of the opera?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: She’s a mezzo soprano with the New York City Opera.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Maddie, as in Madelyn Corday?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen her perform. She – she’s an absolute revelation. I just can’t picture her … … with you. How would you even meet her?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: College. We had the same major –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You majored in opera singing?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: No. Musical theater.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. And if you tell anyone I’m going to force feed you your spleen through your nose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry, I’m trying to be scared. I just keep picturing you doing jazz hands.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t lie to us. We’re not in the mood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We had to Uber here.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What? Where’s your car?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s – not important. What is important is that we need to find him. Now.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, we haven’t seen him for hours. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle stole our car after we arrested Slaughter.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s – uh, really not funny.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It really is, though.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, knock it off.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But, wait. Wait. Why did you arrest Slaughter? According to Dad he didn’t kill Victor Lee.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s not the point.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s kind of the point.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, we had reason to believe that Slaughter, but –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now we’re not so sure.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, I can tell you this: that genius kid Louis definitely didn’t kill him, either.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: While I was tracking his IP address for Castle I noticed that during the time of the murder Louis was at a coffee shop in Brooklyn.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And a barista remembers seeing him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which makes David Lacey our prime suspect.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Who’s this Lacey guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He runs a heist crew. With a trail of bodies. We’ve got one of his soldiers in holding but he’s not talking.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, is my dad in danger?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We really need to find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fast.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yum, yum, yum, yum.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Try that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I do some of my best thinking when I’m cooking. It’s what got me through my divorce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to you and Maddie?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Her career took off, mine failed to launch. I got jealous. Went downhill from there. What really happened with you and your wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I told you, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You’re too smart to be talking this stupid, Sherlock. If you really love that broad you figure out what the problem is and you do something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! It’s the kid.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Oh God, not you again. I’m looking for Detective Slaughter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s –

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Victor told me that if I ever got into trouble to find you. He said that you’d look out for me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: He did? I mean, yeah. Yeah. Of course I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute, how did you find him here?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I hacked his life.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You what my life?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I used a cryptographic generator I created to get your Social Security Number. After that it was – it was simple guesswork. I went through your credit cards, your bank statements, and when I discovered you had an ex-wife who was currently performing in Italy I found it odd that her home alarm system had recently been disarmed. I knocked down a few firewalls, got into your ex’s calendar, and discovered the housekeeper doesn’t come until Thursday, so I assumed it was you. I hacked her desktop’s IP address and here I am.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Maybe I should be calling him Sherlock.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Someone’s here.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey, kid. Tell us where you are and then I want you to hide.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I – I’m at a warehouse –

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey! Damn it, we lost him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe not. Look at the wall.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fumigation notice. You can just make out the company name and the phone number.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really think we should call for backup.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ah, screw that. Come on.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I see the kid. He’s tied to a chair. Looks like he’s being interrogated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By how many?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I only see one. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You don’t even have a gun.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: It’s just one guy. Come on!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey buddy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Piece of cake, huh?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: What’s the matter, kid?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: I guess we should have called for backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Okay, chuckleheads. Killing a police officer is not exactly a good addition to your rap sheet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or – or a bestselling author.

utterance.speaker: DAVID LACEY
utterance.content: It’s kind of hard to charge us with murder if nobody ever finds the bodies.

utterance.speaker: THUG
utterance.content: Should I take the kid out of here?

utterance.speaker: LACEY
utterance.content: Nah, let him watch. This way he knows what’s going to happen to him if he doesn’t do exactly what I ask.

utterance.speaker: LACEY
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: LACEY
utterance.content: Hey, knock it off!

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Sherlock, we’re going to die here. Let’s at least try to do it like men, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Boy, boy, crazy boy. Get cool, boy! Got a rocket in your pocket, keep coolly cool boy!”

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: “Don’t get hot, ‘cause man you got some high times ahead.”

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER_CASTLE
utterance.content: “Boy, boy, crazy boy. Stay loose, boy! Breeze it, buzz it, easy does it.”

utterance.speaker: LACEY
utterance.content: Will someone please shoot these guys?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER_CASTLE
utterance.content: “Turn off the juice, boy!” Fight scene!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry!

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE ETHAN SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Is that it? Is that all the guys you brought?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think we enjoy this?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Hey uh … thanks for coming for me. Victor wasn’t wrong about you.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, but I was wrong about Victor. He was a crappy role model.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: You’re a crappy singer.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hey. You nail Lacey and his crew?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. They’ll being doing some serious time for kidnapping and attempted murder.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Whoa. Why aren’t they getting charged with actual murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because none of them killed Victor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They were at a restaurant in SoHo at the time of Victor’s homicide.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: So we’re right back to square one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Louis, is there anything you can remember about Victor’s death?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: No, nothing. I swear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you and Victor, you did use your device to break into Booth Tower and steal that microchip, right?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Victor came to me with the idea. All right? He was sick of living paycheck to paycheck. Promised to split the profit that we got from selling the chip to Booth’s competitor. I could take care of my mom for once. When he didn’t show up for the chip I didn’t know what to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, you have the chip?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was that part of the plan?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: No. When we were leaving the tower Victor started getting all weird.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why? What happened?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he deviated from our plan. He told me to hang on to the chip and that he would catch up later. He said that he had to take care of some business.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: That’s probably part of the bigger score.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Wait, what bigger score?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hate to tell you, kid. That break in was never just about stealing that microchip. It was an advertisement to all the heist crews in town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For your invention. Victor was using you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Booth, I’m Detective Ryan. This is Detective Esposito.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Oh. So that’s the punk that broke into my building, turned me into a late night punchline, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We recovered your microchip.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Who cares. Word in private.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Gentlemen, as you know I am a generous supporter of the NYPD, be it the Policeman’s Ball or the Widows and Orphans Fund –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Booth, is there something you need from us?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: A favor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A discreet one, I take it.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Yes. The money I’d lose if a rival brought a version of that microchip to market before me pales in comparison to the real fortune that punk kid stole from my building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What fortune is that?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Earlier today fifty million dollars was wired from a Cayman Islands account I have. A private account.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You mean a secret account.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: From my wife. It needs to stay that way. So I need you to do whatever it takes to recover my money quietly to avoid further scandal, you understand?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What makes you think this kid stole your money?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Who else could have? Account number, transfer codes, they were kept in an electronic safe in my office two floors up from the clean room where he stole the microchip. I mean, the kid’s a genius. Got a device that can open any lock, right?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: I don’t know anything about a Cayman account and I sure as hell didn’t steal fifty million!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Louis, come on, man. Be straight with us.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, kid. If you took that money, first of all, impressive, but more importantly you’ve gotta fess up.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Look, it wasn’t me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, I think he’s telling the truth. If Louis stole the money why would he go to Slaughter for help in the first place? Why would we find him hiding in a warehouse?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Look, Sherlock’s got a point here. Kid’s a genius. For fifty million dollars he’d drop off the face of the Earth before we could even blink.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. Louis, is it possible that Victor stole the codes from that safe?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: No. No way. He was with me every second we were inside that building.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what are we saying here? Someone else broke into that building, too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. You said that when you and Victor left the building he started acting strange and broke from the original plan by giving you the microchip.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he did that because he saw something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something that made him think that someone else was piggybacking on their burglary to pull a heist of their own. Who else knew about your plan?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: No one. At least not from me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: But maybe from Victor.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Hey, wait a minute. When we accessed the building’s service elevators in the basement Victor wedged the door open. But when we left it was closed. I – I assumed it was a draft.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Could have been a second thief. Hot damn, that’s gotta be what spooked Victor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe when Victor said that he had to take care of something first, it was to confront this piggyback thief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means whoever our second burglar was, he not only knew about the plan to rob Booth but also had knowledge of where Booth kept those codes for his secret account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We find that person, we find our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re missing something, gentlemen. More specifically, we’re missing someone. A person who knew Victor and Louis were planning their heist and had intimate knowledge of Booth’s finances. We’ll find our killer in the intersection of that Venn diagram.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the question is, who could that be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Espo. You’re not really going to charge Louis, are you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He broke the law, Castle. It’s not Monopoly. There’s no get out of jail free card.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Grand theft. Even though he’s a minor he’s looking at real time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kid never stood a chance. All his life he’d been taken advantage of by adults who should be acting like his role models.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up, man? You got something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah. While questioning Mr. Booth about his Cayman Islands accounts he told me they were set up a mere five years ago.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So guess who worked at the accounting firm who originally set them up?

utterance.speaker: MARK WEST
utterance.content: I’m just glad you guys were able to find Louis before something horrible happened to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, uh … we got lucky. Please, have a seat.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Poor kid. He’s – he’s been through so much. You know, I’d like to testify as a character witness on Louis’s behalf when this case goes to trial.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s very kind of you, Mr. West. But won’t you be too busy with your own trial?

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: My trial? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: You know what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, for starters, you didn’t always work with at-risk youth.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: No. I mean, I’ve had other jobs. So?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you were Mr. Booth’s accountant. Where you worked on his most sensitive matters.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like setting up tax shelters in off shore banks.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Well, yeah. But the work was unfulfilling, so I left because I wanted to give back to the community.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, you wanted to give back to Mr. Booth’s wife, but she didn’t appreciate your sexual advances, so Mr. Booth fired your ass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, you lost your job, you lost your pension, all those stock options.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: All right, listen. I know how this looks, but –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your reputation was ruined. The only job you could get was working with juvenile delinquents.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not exactly the cushy life you were used to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you heard about Louis’s invention. And you saw not only a way to get back on top –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But also get revenge on your former boss who ruined your life. That’s why you convinced Victor to pull that heist, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you could go in right behind him and steal those Cayman Island bank codes.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Well, that is an imaginative story. You got surprise twists, revenge. All that’s missing is the proof.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like records of the bank transfers on your home computer? We got a warrant for your place, Mark.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We also have a credit card receipt for a cab ride that you took to Victor’s apartment on the night he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s over, Mr. West.

utterance.speaker: WEST
utterance.content: Look, Victor wasn’t supposed to know what I was doing. But somehow he found out and he confronted me at his apartment. Now, I panicked, okay? I didn’t mean to kill him. I – you have to believe me. That was not –

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Ah, come on. It ain’t that bad, kid. We caught the bastard, didn’t we?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Yeah. But I’m still going to prison. How much time am I looking at?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Maybe none.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: What? How?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You’re a good kid, Louis. Too good to be rotting in a cell for a few bonehead decisions. So from now on I’m going to personally see to it that you’ve got someone looking out for you. That you’ve got a cool role model.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: You mean Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: No. Me.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: You bet. First thing I’m going to do is I’m going to use my pull to get the Mayor to ask the DA to reduce your sentence down to probation.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: You’ve got that kind of clout with the Mayor?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Hell no. But Castle does. And I’m going to see to it that he makes that call. Or else.

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: So – so you’re going to beat up Mr. Castle if he doesn’t do what you ask?

utterance.speaker: LOUIS
utterance.content: Some role model.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. You got a point. Looks like the two of us are going to have to do some role modeling for each other. Sound good?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Uh oh, you got that dumb look on your face again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um – I don’t know. I’m just confused about Beckett.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: That makes two of us. I mean, how does a hot lady like that fall in love with a guy like you? Especially when there’s real men like me running around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, Slaughter, I’ll take a lot of crap from you, but not about Beckett. It’s not a joke to me.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Just trying to get your attention, Sherlock. Look, I don’t know much, but what I do know is that lady has it bad for you. And you feel the same.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your point?

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Whatever’s going on with Beckett, she shouldn’t have to go through it alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, I’ve tried. She won’t let me in.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Then quit asking permission. I lost my wife because I wasn’t man enough to put her needs ahead of mine. Don’t make the same mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what, Slaughter? For all your bluster and bravado, you are actually a wise, and dare I say sensitive –

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Whoa! Hey! Stop right there. Only you could take two guys talking about a chick and make it weird.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah. Me too.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Every time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Whatever, Sherlock.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
